benchmark_details.name: ChatGPT-FC (ChatGPT Fact-checking Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: The ChatGPT-FC dataset combines human-verified fact-checking reports and complementary information generated by ChatGPT to provide a comprehensive resource for fake news detection. It includes both human and LLM evaluations of news statements from polifact.com with a focus on mitigating human biases.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset that mitigates biases in fake news detection by combining human judgment and LLM-generated assessments.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The prompt design for fact-checking responses can be further improved, as some cases (0.04%) result in invalid responses from ChatGPT.

data.annotation: Fact-checking reports labeled by human journalists and generated by ChatGPT.

methodology.calculation: Truthfulness scores range from 0 to 100, indicating the confidence in the accuracy of the news statements.
methodology.interpretation: A higher score indicates greater confidence in the truthfulness of the statement.
methodology.validation: Evaluation of LLM responses against human-verified reports shows differential biases.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Bias analysis conducted regarding news creators and subject credibility.
